hydra.compute

Class StatelessAdapter<T1,T2,V1,V2>

  • java.lang.Object
    • hydra.compute.Adapter<Unit,Unit,T1,T2,V1,V2>
      • hydra.compute.StatelessAdapter<T1,T2,V1,V2>

  • public class StatelessAdapter<T1,T2,V1,V2>
extends Adapter<Unit,Unit,T1,T2,V1,V2>
    A convenience class for stateless adapters; we use Hydra's Unit as the state type. Note: using Java's Void is problematic because of the interaction of Optional with null values.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class hydra.compute.Adapter

        coder, isLossy, NAME, source, target

      static <T1,T2,V1,V2>
      StatelessAdapter<T1,T2,V1,V2>      		 unidirectional(T1 source, T2 target, java.util.function.Function<V1,Flow<Unit,V2>> encode)
      Construct a unidirectional adapter; encoding follows the provided function, while decoding will fail gracefully.
